column4: What driver do you use for that card. radeon (opensource) or catalyst?
... and what card do you have?
Default one maybe ?
ATI radeon.
open a console and type... lspci | grep VGA
OK

As I see, you should have the option to install the catalyst driver. That might help with your VGA problem. As stated by Dr_Willis_, run jockey-gtk in a console. It will look for 'additional drivers' on for your system.
Thanks :)
Dr_Willis_: http://pastebin.com/1L8HJbCJ >_< error
Looks that it did not download the driver... You were able to activate the driver and then Ubuntu asked you to reboot?
No, just received that message but no reboot asked.
Rebooting ?
Ok. So you cannot activate the driver?
Yes. It says not yet
Looks like 'installation went well'... see that bug... The poster of post two is an ubuntu developper. So you should be save to reboot... https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/jockey/+bug/705986
Dr_Willis_Thanks again :) I'll keep using this version without my external monitor.
Again... looks like installation is ok...
I see :)
I can use my laptop minitor without having problem but any external monitors with VGA. It shaking and hurting my eyes.
With that catalyst driver too? Check the new installed ATI configuration tool.
OK :)
Thanks :) you saved me and saved Ubuntu :P
No problem.
